summary.p: 95 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: R. 6; Text: ?; 14 lines per page; Dimensions: 375 x 270 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 2nd (8th) to 3rd (9th) centuries [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. The catalogue entry does not contain information about the text that the fragment covers.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 5: "13 R. 6 Mushaf Parşömen. 270mm boy ve 375mm eninde çönk formasında 95 yaprak. Bir çok yapraklar zayi olduğundan kâğıt üzerine muhtelif nesih yazılarla tamamlanmıştır. Kûfî kısmı sahifede 295mm uzunl.[uğunda] 14 satırı havidir. Tahmine göre II-III (VIII-IX) asıra ait olmalıdır. İlâvelerin VII, (XII) asırda yapılmış olması tahmin olunabilir. Miklepli ve kırmızı şemseli siyah deri Osmanlı cildi."

This can be translated as follows: "13 R. 6 Codex of the Qurʾān. Parchment. 95 junk shaped leaves of 270 mm height and 375 mm width. Since many leaves were damaged in between, it was completed by writing on paper with different kinds of naskh. The Kufic part contains 14 lines of 295 mm. Probably it is from II-III (VIII-IX) centuries. It can be assumed that the additions are from VII (XII) century. Black Ottoman leather binding with flap (miklep) and red mandorla (shamsa)."
